body_html:
Are you using version 12.1 by chance? That version provided new format for saving checkpoints, but didn't provide a way to read them. The solution is to save in old format:

saver = tf.train.Saver(write_version = saver_pb2.SaverDef.V1)

see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41048819/how-to-restore-a-model-by-filename-in-tensorflow-r12
body_text:
Are you using version 12.1 by chance? That version provided new format for saving checkpoints, but didn't provide a way to read them. The solution is to save in old format:
saver = tf.train.Saver(write_version = saver_pb2.SaverDef.V1)
see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41048819/how-to-restore-a-model-by-filename-in-tensorflow-r12
body:
Are you using version 12.1 by chance? That version provided new format for saving checkpoints, but didn't provide a way to read them. The solution is to save in old format:

`saver = tf.train.Saver(write_version = saver_pb2.SaverDef.V1)`

see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41048819/how-to-restore-a-model-by-filename-in-tensorflow-r12
